Posts.Content: mom2to wrote: ARRRRGH - dx idc 6/08 - brca 1 positive - bil mast 8/08 -tissue expanders, exchange surgery 12/08 I found two small lumps in OTHER breast (implant).  Had ultrasound.  Ultrasound doc says it's not necessarily cancer, but if it isn't, they don't have clue what they could be.  Am going for biopsy Monday. The ultrasound indicated that both spots had blood flowing. There is just such a thin layer of skin over the implants (410s) - what else could these lumps be?  ER/PR+,Her2-, 0/11 nodes, 1.3 cm,Arimidex since 10/08 Dx 6/20/2008, IDC, 1cm, 0/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2009 03:10PM mom2to wrote: I like that "Fists up!" The doctor who felt the lump thought one was a cyst, the other fat necrosis.  But, after the ultrasound, she said they didn't look like either of those. . .but in the next breath said it doesn't necessarily look like cancer.  There isn't even supposed to be any breast tissue there!
